title: Domain 1.10: Identify common features and tools of the macOS/desktop OS.
content:
üíª Installation and Uninstallation of Applications

  • .dmg: Disk image used to install macOS software.
  • .pkg: Installer package used for macOS applications.
  • .app: The application bundle itself ‚Äì drag to /Applications to install.
  • App Store: Central location for downloading, updating, and managing apps.
  • Uninstallation: Typically drag the .app file to the Trash to uninstall.

üçè Apple ID and Corporate Restrictions

  • Apple ID: Used for iCloud, App Store, Messages, and syncing devices.
  • Corporate Restrictions: Managed via MDM tools (e.g., JAMF) to limit access, enforce policies.

üîß Best Practices

  • Backups: Use Time Machine or other tools to back up regularly.
  • Antivirus: Protect against malware or phishing, especially in business environments.
  • Updates/Patches: Keep system and apps up to date for security and performance.

‚öôÔ∏è System Preferences

  • Displays: Adjust resolution, scale, and arrangement for multiple monitors.
  • Networks: Set Wi-Fi, Ethernet, VPN, and proxy options.
  • Printers/Scanners: Add and manage local or network printers and scanners.
  • Privacy: Manage app permissions for camera, microphone, location, etc.
  • Accessibility: Configure tools for visual, hearing, or motor accessibility needs.
  • Time Machine: Built-in backup tool that auto-saves versions and backups to external drives.

üíª Features

  • Multiple Desktops: Organize workspaces across virtual desktops.
  • Mission Control: View and manage all open windows and desktops.
  • Keychain: Store passwords and credentials securely.
  • Spotlight: Search bar to find files, apps, documents, and perform calculations/web searches.
  • iCloud: Syncs files, photos, messages across Apple devices.
  • Gestures: Use trackpad gestures to navigate quickly (e.g., swipe between desktops).
  • Finder: The file explorer for macOS.
  • Remote Disc: Access discs from another Mac or networked device.

üõ†Ô∏è Disk Utility

Use to erase, partition, and repair drives. Also helps check for drive errors and format new disks.

üîí FileVault

Encrypts your entire hard drive for maximum security. Requires password or recovery key to unlock.

üíª Terminal

Command-line tool for advanced users. Use it to navigate, install packages, or write shell scripts.

üö´ Force Quit

Use Command + Option + Esc to open Force Quit window and close frozen apps.
